item.title: [u"On Redis & AES Encryption in the 9447's CTF", u"On Redis & AES Encryption in the 9447's CTF"]
item.description:
During this last weekend, the 9447 CTF took place. One of the misc problems was called NoSQL and had the following description, together with an attachment with three files:

    Hey, I don't understand how SQL works so I made my own NoSQL startup. And OpenSSL is bloody crap.

    ip …
item.dc:creator: Marina von Steinkirch

item.title: Quick and Dirty intro to OpenPGP & GPG
item.description: Pretty Good Privacy (PGP) is a model that provides cryptographic privacy and authentication for data communication. It was created by Phil Zimmermann in 1991. Today, PGP is a company that sells a proprietary encryption program, OpenPGP is the open protocol that defines how PGP encryption works, and GnuGP is the …
item.dc:creator: Marina von Steinkirch

item.title: The Peace Pipe at Hack.lu's Final CTF 2014
item.description:
Last week was the Hack.lu Final CTF. In this post I discuss one of my favorite crypto problems in that CTF: the "Peace Pipe".

Understanding the Problem

The problem starts with this weird story:

After a long day, you sit around a campfire in the wild wild web with …
item.dc:creator: Marina von Steinkirch

item.title: On Paillier Ciphersystem, Binary Search and the ASIS CTF 2014
item.description:
The ASIS CTF happened last weekend. Although I ended up not playing all I wanted, I did spend some time working on a crypto challenge that was worth a lot of points in the game. The challenge was about a sort of not well-known system, the Paillier cryptosystem.

The Cryptosystem …
item.dc:creator: Marina von Steinkirch

item.title: Cryptography War: Beating Krypton
item.description:
Continuing to talk about the Wargames, today I'll briefly go through Krypton, the cryptography episode.

The problems are very straightforward and very similar to those from the last CSAW CTF (see my post here).

Disclaimer: if you haven't played WarGames but you are planing to, PLEASE DON'T READY ANY FURTHER …
